Posts Views Module¶

posts.views.authentication(request)[source]¶

Checks if the user is logged in and returns True or redirects user back to the login page.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object.

Returns:

HTTP redirection response.

Return type:

Django HttpResponseRedirect Object

posts.views.post_create(request)[source]¶

This function will create a new post.

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered template for creating a new post.

Return type:

Django Render Object

posts.views.post_delete(request, pk)[source]¶

This function will delete an existing post.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary key of the post to be deleted

Returns:

Redirect to the post list after deletion.

Return type:

Django Redirect Object

posts.views.post_detail(request, pk)[source]¶

This function will render a template displaying the specific post details.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary key of the post.

Returns:

Rendered template with details of the specific post.

Return type:

Django Render Object

posts.views.post_list(request)[source]¶

This function will render a template displaying of all posts

Parameters:

request – HTTP request object.

Returns:

Rendered template with a list of posts.

Return type:

Django Render Object

posts.views.post_update(request, pk)[source]¶

This function will update an existing post.

Parameters:

  • request – HTTP request object.

  • pk – Primary key of the post to be updated.

Returns:

Rendered template for updating the specific post.

Return type:

Django Render Object
